steps.title: Find Agent Harper
steps.text:
In this scenario, the task of investigators is to find out which suspect opponent kidnapped Agent Harper and on which one Hiding place she is being held. It does this by allowing investigators to discover clues that they can spend to get cards out of the View or pull the track deck.
Each card in the track deck represents either one of the possible Suspect opponent or a possible hiding place. Since the correct Opponent and location can be found under Agent Harper's overview map no card in the track deck would be the right solution. The number of possible Opponents and locations can be reduced by the elimination process, by investigating these cards or putting them into play. in the Campaign log, these enemies and locations can be crossed out.
When the investigators are sure who the kidnapper is and where Agent Harper can be found, they can use the investigation target ability on Use scene 1a to advance. But be careful - the time to find out the truth is short, so investigators may there is nothing left but to guess ...

Each investigator earns experience points equal to Victory X value of all cards in the victory point pile. Note these experience points in the campaign log under "Unissued XP". These experience points are allowed not yet issued. The investigators will instructed spend these experience points at a later date.

With the knowledge gathered, investigators must make an allegation to find out who kidnapped Elina Harper and where it is kept hidden. To make the accusation the investigators must choose 1 suspect and 1 hiding spot from the options listed on the Find Agent Harper overview card. Note: the suspect cannot be an opponent currently in the Game or in the victory point pile. The hiding place cannot either be the location currently in play. Investigators should think carefully before making a choice.
Once the allegation has been made, the following happens:

bullets.text: The suspect opponent and the hiding place under the map Finding Agent Harper is revealed. In the campaign log are listed under "Possible suspects / Possible hiding places" of the correct suspect opponents and the correct hiding place circled.
If no card matches the allegation, they are Investigators are on the wrong track and must give up immediately.

If only 1 of the 2 cards matches the allegation, the investigators are only partially right and are allowed to use the scenario Continue. You have been doing this with your careless determination however, the citizens of Innsmouth upset. The overview map Finding Agent Harper is turned over and the enemy is on top of this Side of the map appears in Innsmouth Market Place.
If both cards match the allegation, have the investigators agree and are allowed to proceed with the scenario.
